physical_appearance: This map depicts the islands of Sangir and Talaud.  Different colours are used on the different islands, ranging from pink to turquoise to yellow. The map is divided in the middle with vertical line. However, the same set of scales, 1: 05, are being utilized on both parts. Straight black lines that run diagonal, vertical, and horizontal extend out from the two compasses that are located in both parts of the map.Pictorial representations of mountains and hills are drawn in many of the islands.
sgcool_label_text: Francois Valentijn (1666â€“1727) was a minister, naturalist and writer who served the Dutch V.O.C. in the East Indies in the late 17th and early 18th centuries. His monumental work Oud en Nieuw Oost-Indien (Old and New East-India), published between 1724 and 1726, offers a comprehensive mapping of the East Indies with a large selection of scale maps and views. These charts of the Sangir (left) and Talaud (right) islands in North Sulawesi were published in that work.
title_text: Het Eyland Sangir/De Talautse Eylanden (The Sangir Island/The Talaud Islands)
subject_terms_2: Colonization East Indies Maps Islands Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie Sangihe-Talaud (Indonesia)
